table_caption: Cross-sectional analysis of DTI metrics in the subcortical white matter volumes of interest in patients with sporadic CJD compared with control subjects after multi-comparison correction (FDR)
table_foot: Mean diffusivity, axial and radial diffusivity values are reported in mm2/s × 10−3 at a lobar level as average ± SD for both control and sporadic CJD groups. The significance is reported as ***P < 0.001, **P < 0.01, *P < 0.05, (*) trend with P < 0.1, with sporadic CJD DTI metrics reduced versus controls. NS = non-significant; MD = mean diffusivity; FA = fractional anisotropy; AD = axial diffusivity; RD = radial diffusivity. No DTI metrics were increased in any volumes of interest in sporadic CJD.
